cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles NW of Cozumel, Mexico over the southern Gulf of Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to accelerate north-northeast, cross Florida’s Big Bend Monday, then track northeastward just offshore the U.S. East Coast and move into the western Atlantic toward the Canadian Maritimes.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Indian Pass–Englewood)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm warning in effect Indian Pass FL to Englewood FL (Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Indian Pass FL to Englewood FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, then the southeast and mid-Atlantic coasts as the system moves northeast just offshore
weather_observation.wind: Only a very low (≤3 %) chance of sustained 34 kt winds; breezy conditions possible late Tuesday night–Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port given the forecast offshore track.
weather_observation.rainfall: No heavy rainfall signal for the New York area in current guidance.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated that would materially affect port operations.
